Show device model, OS version IMEI and other information

This WSO2 Device Management Agent app requires access to certain administrator functions on your device. Here is a list of those administrator functions and why access is required for each of them: 

- Erase All Data: This permission is required to enable you to remotely use the factory data reset option. 

- Change the Screen Lock: This permission is required to allow you to remotely change your screen lock type. 

- Set password rules: This permission is required to allow you to remotely set password rules to your device. 

- Monitor screen unlock attempts: This permission is required to allow you to detect unlock attempts on your device with incorrect passwords and to enable factory resetting of your device if the number of unlock attempts are exceeded. 

- Lock Screen: This permission is required to allow you to remotely lock the screen of your device. 

- Set screen lock password expiration: This permission is required to allow you to remotely set an expiration time for your screen lock password. 

- Set storage encryption: This permission is required to allow remote encryption of your device storage. 

- Disable cameras: This is required to for you to remotely allow/disallow camera usage on your device. 

You will be prompted to Activate Device Admin after registering your device with WSO2 Device cloud and by clicking "Activate" you consent to this App having access to the above administrator functions on your device. 

You can revoke your consent at anytime by opening WSO2 Device Management Agent app and clicking on "Unregister" or by going to Settings \-\>Security \-\> Device Administrators and Deactivating WSO2 Device Management Agent. 

All remote operations can only be triggered from the Device Management Console in the WSO2 Device Cloud and can only be performed by authorized user. 

All data sent to the WSO2 Device cloud is only accessible to the authorized user and can be permanently removed if needed.
